laboratory_examinations.findings: Labs at OSH were within normal limits.

findings.Liver: Transient mosaic enhancement of the liver parenchyma, mild periportal edema, no focal liver lesions, trace upper abdominal ascites.
findings.Biliary: Radiodense stone in the gallbladder neck is now in the gallbladder fundus, mild gallbladder wall edema, no intra or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.
findings.Pancreas: Normal in signal and bulk, no peripancreatic stranding.
findings.Kidneys: Enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically, no hydronephrosis or masses.
findings.Gastrointestinal Tract: Small and large bowel normal in caliber, fluid in transverse mesocolon, hyperenhancing mucosa of transverse colon suggesting mild transverse colitis.
findings.Vasculature: Normal caliber abdominal aorta, patent portal and hepatic veins.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Compared to the outside hospital CT, the radiodense stone in the gallbladder neck has moved to the gallbladder fundus and the gallbladder is no longer distended.
